answers.answer: Normally you only go once a month until the last month or two when you start going once a week but it could just depend on your doctor or specific situation.
No you usually go every 4 weeks up until your closer to the end

If your pregnancy is high risk they'll make you go more. With a normal pregnancy you would go once every four weeks until about the 8th month. Then you'd go once every two weeks. At about week 35 you'd start going every week.
They haven't told me if I am high risk or not which really scares me. I think today they will be going over my blood work and all the test they took at my first visit.

I went monthly up until my last appointment on 2/23. Now that I'm in the 3rd trimester I start going every 2 weeks. When I get 35 weeks, I'll have my appointment weekly. That's how they do it at my doctor, but I'm sure everywhere is a bit different. Good Luck!
I went every two weeks. Now that I'm in my second I only have to go every month.

I went monthly until I reached 30 weeks. At 30 weeks I went every 2 weeks. At 36 weeks I will be going every week.If you are going more often in the beginning it is usually because there is a risk, worry of M/C, checking on baby growth etc.... Although I am sure there are Dr. out there who don't go by the monthly time frame.

I'm not high risk and my doctor wanted me to go every 2 weeks. He is money hungry! Every time I go there my insurance company pays him A LOT of money so it's no wonder that he wants me there all the time. Totally unnecessary. The standard is what has been said here - every 4 weeks. Unless, of course, you have one of the major medical conditions - high blood pressure, diabetes, etc. If you're healthy, then you're not high risk! Beware of money hungry doctors!!! I decided to switch to a different OB.

question: Today will be my second time. I've been going every two weeks. Is this normal?
title: how often during my first trimester should i go to the doctor?
